resources.name: DOORS Community Reentry Center
resources.description: Comprehensive reentry center providing housing assistance, employment services, educational programs, legal aid, mental health services, substance use counseling, and supportive services for individuals returning from incarceration.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to anyone with an interest in reentry in Los Angeles County, including formerly incarcerated people and their families.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles reentry services 2025'

resources.name: Anti-Recidivism Coalition (ARC)
resources.description: Empowers formerly and currently incarcerated people to thrive by providing a support network, comprehensive reentry services, and opportunities to advocate for policy change. Founded by members who are directly impacted by incarceration.
services_offered: Transitional housing (Bromont, Magnolia, Hollywood CPR Dorm)
resources.eligibility_requirements: Services available to formerly and currently incarcerated individuals. Housing programs have specific eligibility: Bromont serves individuals coming home after 10+ years; Magnolia serves Transitional-Aged Youth (18-25) from juvenile halls; Hollywood CPR serves TAY enrolled in film/TV union preparation program.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles reentry services 2025'

resources.name: Homeboy Industries
resources.description: Provides hope, training, and support to formerly gang-involved and previously incarcerated people through job training, social services, and social enterprises. Offers employment in bakery, silkscreen, merchandise, and caf√© operations.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Serves formerly gang-involved and previously incarcerated men and women. Must be committed to changing their lives and leaving gang lifestyle behind.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles employment services reentry'

resources.name: St. John's Community Health - RISE Reentry Program
resources.description: Through personalized case management, peer navigation, and community-based support, RISE empowers people returning from incarceration to overcome barriers, regain stability, and thrive in their health, relationships, and futures.
services_offered: Peer navigation (support from people with lived experience)
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals returning home from incarceration. Services provided through St. John's Community Health network of clinics in Los Angeles.
resources.fees: Services based on sliding scale - accepting Medi-Cal and other insurance
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles reentry services 2025'

resources.name: Watts Labor Community Action Committee (WLCAC) - Southeast LA WorkSource Center
resources.description: Workforce development agency providing business services for employers and comprehensive employment training and job placement services for low-income residents, including those with criminal justice involvement.
services_offered: WIOA (Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act) programs
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income residents, priority for those with barriers to employment including criminal justice involvement. Must meet WIOA income requirements. Youth services for ages 16-24.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles employment services reentry'

resources.name: Legal Aid Foundation of Los Angeles (LAFLA) - Reentry Legal Services
resources.description: Provides free legal services to remove barriers to employment related to criminal records through expungement, Prop 47 petitions, early termination of probation, and fair chance hiring advocacy.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Free services for low-income Los Angeles County residents. Monthly clinic at LATTC Worksource Center (first Tuesday, 9am-1pm). Weekly clinics at Greater Whittier LGBTQ+ Community Center.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles legal aid expungement reentry'

resources.name: Neighborhood Legal Services of Los Angeles County (NLSLA) - Clean Slate Services
resources.description: Provides free legal services for system-impacted adults and youth to remove legal barriers through criminal record clearing, expungement, and related relief.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income residents of Los Angeles County with household incomes up to 200% of federal poverty guidelines.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles legal aid expungement'

resources.name: Weingart Center - AB109 Reentry Program
resources.description: 90-day transitional program assisting men and women under Post-Release Community Supervision with housing, employment, case management, and comprehensive support services to prepare for successful community reentry.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Must be under AB109 classification through LA County Probation Department Post-Release Community Supervision. Requires referral from HealthRIGHT 360.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Weingart Center AB109 reentry Los Angeles'

resources.name: The Francisco Homes
resources.description: Provides holistic reentry support services and transitional housing specifically for formerly incarcerated 'lifers' on parole, helping men who served long-term sentences (mostly life sentences) rebuild their lives in South Los Angeles.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Men on parole from long-term incarceration, primarily those who served life sentences. Must be committed to successful reentry and community integration.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'The Francisco Homes reentry housing lifers Los Angeles'

resources.name: A New Way of Life Reentry Project
resources.description: Provides comprehensive reentry support for formerly incarcerated women and their families, including safe transitional housing, case management, legal services, advocacy, and leadership development.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Formerly incarcerated women. Services also available to their families. No geographic restrictions - serves LA County and neighboring counties (San Bernardino, Riverside, Orange, Ventura).
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'A New Way of Life reentry housing women Los Angeles'

resources.name: HealthRIGHT 360 - Los Angeles Outpatient Center
resources.description: Provides comprehensive substance use disorder treatment including relapse prevention, anger management, criminal addictive thinking, dialectical behavioral therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, and social support systems for individuals in reentry.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders, including those in criminal justice system or reentry. Can access services by calling LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpline (SASH).
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'HealthRIGHT 360 Los Angeles substance abuse treatment'

resources.name: LA County Office of Diversion and Reentry (ODR)
resources.description: County agency implementing programs to divert individuals with serious mental, physical and/or substance use needs away from the criminal legal system and into tailored long-term community-based care, housing and support services.
services_offered: Misdemeanor Incompetent to Stand Trial Diversion (MIST)
Felony Incompetent to Stand Trial Program (FIST)
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with serious mental, physical, and/or substance use needs who are involved or at risk of involvement with the criminal legal system. Specific eligibility varies by program.
languages: Many languages available through interpretation services
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LA County Office of Diversion and Reentry'

resources.name: Los Angeles Trade-Technical College (LATTC) - Reentry Pathway to Success
resources.description: Educational reentry program assisting formerly incarcerated individuals interested in enrolling at LATTC by providing individual support, resources, connections, and an inclusive community to support academic and career success.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Formerly incarcerated individuals interested in enrolling at LATTC. Must meet community college enrollment requirements.
resources.fees: California Community College enrollment fees - waiver available for eligible low-income students. Financial aid available.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LATTC reentry pathway program'

resources.name: Chrysalis - Downtown Los Angeles
resources.description: Nonprofit organization providing employment services, job-readiness programming, individualized supportive services, and paid transitional employment for homeless, low-income individuals, and those in reentry navigating barriers to the workforce.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Serves individuals experiencing homelessness, poverty, and those navigating barriers to employment including criminal records. Focus on breaking cycles of poverty, homelessness, and recidivism.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Chrysalis Los Angeles employment reentry'

resources.name: Coalition for Responsible Community Development (CRCD) - WorkSource Center
resources.description: Community-based workforce development organization providing employment training, job placement, and financial education services with focus on the most vulnerable and reentry populations in South Los Angeles.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Focus on historically disadvantaged youth and residents of South Los Angeles, including those with criminal justice involvement. Priority for most vulnerable and reentry populations.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Coalition for Responsible Community Development CRCD reentry Los Angeles'

notes: Initial research batch for Los Angeles, CA reentry resources expansion. Focus on priority categories: employment, housing, legal_aid, substance_abuse, general_support. All contact information verified from organization websites and official sources. Services and eligibility requirements sourced directly from organization program descriptions.
